title: Artist Talk: Shahryar Nashat
hero_caption: Courtesy of the artist; David Kordansky Gallery, Los Angeles/New York; Gladstone Gallery, New York/Brussels.
short_description: Artist Shahryar Nashat joins Jordan Carter, curator at Dia Art Foundation, and Susanne Ghez, adjunct curator of Modern and Contemporary art, for a discussion of Nashat's new installation on the Bluhm Family Terrace.
list_description: Artist Shahryar Nashat joins Jordan Carter, curator at Dia Art Foundation, and Susanne Ghez, adjunct curator of Modern and Contemporary art, for a discussion of Nashat's new installation on the Bluhm Family Terrace.
description:
Join artist Shahryar Nashat in conversation with Jordan Carter, curator at Dia Art Foundation, and Susanne Ghez, adjunct curator of Modern and Contemporary art at the Art Institute of Chicago, as they discuss Nashat’s new installation Raw Is the Red on the Bluhm Family Terrace.

Shahryar Nashat is known for his videos and sculptures that interrogate the body and its image as sites of desire, fragmentation, tenderness, and resilience. Focusing on our physical limits and the possibilities of extension, he treats digital and analog technologies—from LEDs to stone and cast resin—as prostheses, props, or stand-ins. For this exhibition Raw Is the Red, the artist presents a newly commissioned sculpture alongside a vitrine-encapsulated “meat object” —both positioned atop an artist-designed stage and set against the backdrop of a pink-filtered skyline.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
